title: Theme Health and welfare - tto123
description: Dit thema valt onder de arrangeerbare leerlijn van de Stercollectie voor Engels voor tweetalig onderwijs, leerjaar 1, 2 en 3. Dit is thema 13 'Health and welfare'. Hier worden onderwerpen besproken zoals dokters, verwondingen, tandartsen en ziekenhuizen. Het thema omvat de volgende onderwerpen: The doctor, The dentist, The hospital en Beauty products. De grammaticaopdrachten behandelen de 'future', present perfect and past perfect en few and little. De laatste grammaticaopdracht bevat een grammaticatoets.

items.content:
You are about to start the theme Health and welfare.
It is about the health and happiness of people.

How are you going to practise?
You are going to practise your writing, reading, listening and speaking skills.
You will visit websites, play games, do exercises and listen to stories.

What are you going to do?
You are going to read, listen, speak and write about health and welfare.
By practising a lot your English will improve!

Need help?
Use the toolbox if you need help. Here you will find (new) words and expressions. You will also find help for grammar and pronunciation.

Have fun!

You have just started the theme Health and welfare.
You will find different things to watch, to listen to, to read and of course to do.
There are videos, recordings, pictures, photos, texts and assignments.
There are different types of assignments. Some of them you have to do on your own, others you are doing in a group.

At the end of those group assignments you are going to discuss the answers in your group. Some assignment will be checked by the computer.
Before starting to work your way through this theme, check with a classmate how much you know about health and welfare already.

content.body:
Health is "a state of complete physical, mental, and social and not only the absence of " according to the World Health Organization (WHO).

well-being is about the body.
well-being is about how people think and feel.
well-being talks about how people live with other people.
It is about family, work, school, and friends,
is the well-being of someone or a group of people: their happiness, health, safety, and fortune*.

*'Welfare is also the idea that everyone should have a minimal living standard. People who cannot reach this standard will be supported, usually by the state' ('a welfare state'). However, when referring to 'welfare' in this theme we mean the well-being of persons or a group of people.
Social
disease
Physical
Welfare
well-being
Mental

items.content:
In this theme you will focus on the following 'can do' statements.

Listening

  • You can understand words and basic sentences that have something to do with Health and welfare.

Reading

  • You can understand words and basic sentences in a simple story about Health and welfare.

Having a conversation

  • You can join a simple conversation when the conversational partner is willing to speak slowly, repeats the sentences, formulates the words and helps you formulate what you're trying to say.
  • You can ask and answer simple questions that have something to do with the theme Health and welfare.

Speaking

  • You can use simple phrases and sentences about the theme Health and welfare.

Writing

  • You can write a short, simple story or an e-mail that has something to do with the theme Health and welfare.

In this theme you are going to do the following things:

  • Listen to people who are talking about doctors, injuries, dentists and hospitals.
  • Read about doctors, injuries, dentists and hospitals.
  • Write a note.
  • Talk about your visit to a dentist, a doctor and a hospital.

But you don't have to be able to do this right away!
If you take the following steps (lessons) you'll find out what you need to know!

Lesson

Title

Activity

1

The doctor

Listen, read, write and speak about going to a doctor.

Grammar: future.

2

The dentist

Listen, read, write and speak about going to a dentist.

Grammar: Present perfect and past perfect.

3

The hospital

Read about hospital rules, listen to recordings about visting the emergency department, write and speak about hospitals.

Grammar: few and little.

4

Beauty products

Listen, read, write and speak about beauty products.

Grammar: grammar test.

Below are the four lessons that belong to this topic.
Make your choice.

Lesson 1

The doctor
Lesson 2

The dentist
Lesson 3

The hospital
Lesson 4

Beauty products

Vocabulary Health and Welfare

Here you can find the vocabulary lists with sentences (chunks) that accompany this theme.
These lists will also be used in the diagnostic test. Talk to your teacher about when you will learn these lists.

Vocabularylist Health and welfare A Health and welfare chunks A
Vocabularylist health and welfare B Health and welfare chunks B
Vocabularylist Health and welfare C

Tip

There are many ways to study vocabulary. You can read the words aloud or copy them.
Click in StudioWozzol on the red arrow for the options.

You've finished the lessons for the theme Health and welfare.
Now it is time for the Finishing touch.
Here you will find four extra reading or speaking assignments.
Choose one or two of the assignments and work together with a classmate.
When you are finished you will make the diagnostic test and fill in the evaluation.

Good luck!

Look at the role-playing game below together with a classmate.
Think of the answers that could be given.
Then play the role-playing game.

Doctor: Good morning. Please have a seat here. What's the problem?
You: .........
Doctor: Do you have diarrhea?
You: ...
Doctor: Do you have any other symptoms?
You: ...
Doctor: When did the symptoms start?
You: ...
Doctor: All right. Please take off your clothes from the waist up and lie down there. ... Just tell me if it hurts when I do this.
You: ...
Doctor: Okay. Let's hope it's just indigestion, but we'll need to run some diagnostic tests to be sure. We'll run a blood test and we'll also need a urine sample.
You: ...
Doctor: Yes, I'll give you a prescription for indigestion tablets.

Divide the class into two groups: doctors and patients.
The doctors download the following two documents:

  • Doctor's Activity Sheet
  • Treatment Cards

The patients download these two Word documents:

  • Patients Activity Sheet
  • Ailment Cards

With each condition (= ailment), the patients visit two doctors.
They ask the doctors for advice and possibly a prescription for medication.
Both the doctor and the patient make a note of the visit on the 'Activity Sheet'.

Good luck!

Situation
Your English pen pal ended up in hospital during her vacation in France.
You decide to send her a card.

Write a short message to the patient.

Make sure you write:

  • a get well wish,
  • a tip about things you can do in the hospital,
  • a nice ending.
  • Say you hope you will see each other again soon.

heading.content: Project D: Enrolling for a new school

items.content:
Situation
Your family has moved to Virginia in America.
You are looking for a new school. When you have found a new school, you must fill in a health form.

Download the PDF-form: School entrance form.
Fill in the form completely.
Make sure you know the name of your doctor and dentist.
If hereditary diseases run in your family, put it on the form.

Ready?
Have the form assessed by your teacher.
Test your knowledge. Make the diagnostic test.

content.body:
Please provide the translation of these words and sentences.

  1. Bloed =
  2. Medicijnen =
  3. Röntgenfoto =
  4. Beterschap! = !
  5. Hersens =
  6. Ik heb mijn arm gebroken. = .
  7. Medicijnen voorschrijven =

Please provide the translation of these words and sentences.

  1. Belly button =
  2. Ribcage =
  3. This is a doctor's prescription. = .
  4. Where does it hurt? = ?
  5. I have a headache. = .
  6. You need lots of bed rest. = .
  7. I am running a fever. = .

In the sentences, use the going to-future.

  1. They (pack) the lunch basket.
  2. I (try) to learn a new sport this year.
  3. Rita (not borrow) Jim's book.

Use the will-future in the sentences.

Once I (finish) the meal, I began to feel sick.

Select the correct answer.

  1. They ... at about 4 o'clock in the afternoon.
  • will arrive
  • are going to arrive
  1. Philip ... 15 next Wednesday.
  • is going to be
  • will be
You've eaten my apple.
You've ate my apple.

Fill in the correct form of the present perfect.

  1. My sister (work) as a nurse for twelve years.
  2. I (finish) my homework.

Fill in the correct form of the past simple and the past perfect in the following sentences.

  1. ​They (sleep) very badly, so they (be) late.
  2. When I (finish) the meal, I (begin) to feel sick.
  3. After he (rob) the bank, he (get) into panic and ran away.

Choose between 'few' and 'little'.

  1. I had to write a letters this morning.
  2. There was only a time to talk to my parents on the phone.
  3. It only takes a minutes.

questions.label: The difference between few and little

prompt.body:
Read the following text.
Diana talks about what she is doing to stay in shape.
After reading the text, answer the questions.

The Gym

I spend my evenings at the gym in the local health club.

I do some exercises for about one hour and then I have a swim for half an hour.

The exercises are spinning and weight and cardio devices. They have games on the machines so if you're cycling, you are also playing a game. It makes it a bit more interesting than just exercising!

Afterwards I go to the sauna for about ten minutes and finish off with a massage in a massaging chair.

I have a real goal in mind: I want to lose weight! I was on holiday in Italy and I ate a lot of pizza. So I want to get back to the original weight that I was.

  1. How long does Diana exercise every night?
  2. What's on the exercise equipment?
  3. Why does Diana exercise every night?

values.value:
1. For an hour
  2. Games are installed on the exercise equipment.
  3. To lose weight.

content.body:
1. For an hour
  2. Games are installed on the exercise equipment.
  3. To lose weight.

prompt.body:
You suffer from a headache and sore throat and make an appointment with the doctor.
The doctor will examine you to find out what's wrong with you.

List six questions he is likely to ask.

values.value:
Sample questions:

  1. What’s bothering you?
  2. Where does it hurt?
  3. Are you running a fever?
  4. Does it hurts when you swallow?
  5. Do you feel nauseous?
  6. Shall I prescribe some medicine?

content.body:
Sample questions:

  1. What's bothering you?
  2. Where does it hurt?
  3. Are you running a fever?
  4. Does it hurts when you swallow?
  5. Do you feel nauseous?
  6. Shall I prescribe some medicine?

prompt.body:
Wordcloud

Read the following text and then make a "wordcloud" on paper.
This wordcloud must contain at least eight words that are relevant to the theme.

Doctor's office

I was feeling a little sick the other day.

I decided the next day to visit my doctor before things got worse.

I called the doctor in the morning, and I made an appointment for 9:30 a.m.

When I arrived at the doctor's office, the nurse gave me some papers and I had to fill out some insurance paperwork and a sheet describing my current medical condition, along with the symptoms I was feeling.

After a few minutes, the nurse called my name and took me back to one of their examination rooms.

The nurse took my vital signs including my temperature and blood pressure, and then I waited until the doctor came in.

After the examination he asked me a few questions and the doctor's diagnosis was that I had a bacterial infection.

She wrote me out a prescription for some medication, which I was supposed to take two times a day.

After the examination by the doctor, I went back to the reception area of the doctor's office and paid the bill. Then I went home with my medicine and went to bed, because I still feel sick.

content.body:
Sample words:

  1. doctor
  2. nurse
  3. sick
  4. prescription
  5. medication
  6. examination
  7. diagnosis
  8. ...

items.content:
You started this theme you with a test in the section Need to know.

  • Do this test again.
  • Are your results better than the first time?

At the end of each lesson you answered evaluation questions. Use these answers to answer the following questions:

  • What new things did you learn?
  • Which assignment was the best one to learn from?
  • Are you able to do what you have to do?

Timing
In the introduction of each double period there is an indication of the amount of time you need to do the activity.

  • What do you think of this timing?

Group work

  • What do you think of working in a group?
  • Did every group member do the same amount of work?
